t: Isaiah 43
Israel’s Only Savior
But*pn now, this is what the Lord*s says— he*ld who created you, Jacob, he*ld who formed you, Israel: “Do*ln not fear, for I have redeemed you; I*ld have summoned you by name; you are mine.

When*ln you pass through the waters, I*ld will be with you; and*ln when you pass through the rivers, they*ld will not sweep over you. When*ln you walk through the fire, you*ld will not be burned; the*ld flames will not set you ablaze.
For*ln I am the Lord*s your God, the*ld Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I*ln give Egypt for your ransom, Cush*ld and Seba in your stead.
Since*ln you are precious and honored in my sight, and*ld because I love you, I*ln will give people in exchange for you, nations*ld in exchange for your life.
Do*ln not be afraid, for I am with you; I*ld will bring your children from the east and*ld gather you from the west.
I*ln will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ and*ld to the south, ‘Do not hold them back.’ Bring*ln my sons from afar and*ld my daughters from the ends of the earth—
everyone*ln who is called by my name, whom*ld I created for my glory, whom*ld I formed and made.”
Lead*pn out those who have eyes but are blind, who*ld have ears but are deaf.

All*ln the nations gather together and*ld the peoples assemble. Which*ln of their gods foretold this and*ld proclaimed to us the former things? Let*ln them bring in their witnesses to prove they were right, so*ld that others may hear and say, “It is true.”

“You*ln are my witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “and*ld my servant whom I have chosen, so*ln that you may know and believe me and*ld understand that I am he. Before*ln me no god was formed, nor*ld will there be one after me.
I,*ln even I, am the Lord,*s and*ld apart from me there is no savior.
I*ln have revealed and saved and proclaimed— I,*ld and not some foreign god among you. You*ln are my witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “that I am God.
Yes,*ld and from ancient days I am he. No*ln one can deliver out of my hand. When*ld I act, who can reverse it?”
God’s Mercy and Israel’s Unfaithfulness

This*pn is what the Lord*s says— your*ld Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For*ln your sake I will send to Babylon and*ld bring down as fugitives all the Babylonians, in*ld the ships in which they took pride.
I*ln am the Lord,*s your Holy One, Israel’s*ld Creator, your King.”
This*pn is what the Lord*s says— he*ld who made a way through the sea, a*ld path through the mighty waters,
who*ln drew out the chariots and horses, the*ld army and reinforcements together, and*ln they lay there, never to rise again, extinguished,*ld snuffed out like a wick:
“Forget*ln the former things; do*ld not dwell on the past.
See,*ln I am doing a new thing! Now*ld it springs up; do you not perceive it? I*ln am making a way in the wilderness and*ld streams in the wasteland.
The*ln wild animals honor me, the*ld jackals and the owls, because*ln I provide water in the wilderness and*ld streams in the wasteland, to*ln give drink to my people, my chosen,
the*ld people I formed for myself that*ld they may proclaim my praise.
“Yet*pn you have not called on me, Jacob, you*ld have not wearied yourselves for me, Israel.
You*ln have not brought me sheep for burnt offerings, nor*ld honored me with your sacrifices. I*ln have not burdened you with grain offerings nor*ld wearied you with demands for incense.
You*ln have not bought any fragrant calamus for me, or*ld lavished on me the fat of your sacrifices. But*ln you have burdened me with your sins and*ld wearied me with your offenses.
“I,*pn even I, am he who blots out your*ld transgressions, for my own sake, and*ld remembers your sins no more.
Review*ln the past for me, let*ld us argue the matter together; state*ld the case for your innocence.
Your*ln first father sinned; those*ld I sent to teach you rebelled against me.
So*ln I disgraced the dignitaries of your temple; I*ld consigned Jacob to destruction and*ld Israel to scorn.
